intro: Talbotiella bakossiensis, commonly known as the Bakossi talbotia, is a flowering plant native to Cameroon. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, forested areas and has a woody stem with palmate leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or red, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
